title: Android Debug App crashes after reloading it few times
body:
# Problem Android App crashes after reloading a few times. (while fast refresh is disabled) It usually doesn't show anything on UI and just crashes, but sometime it shows this error screen
This is known issue https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-reanimated/issues/2702 ([stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70335156/how-to-resolve-react-native-navigation-error-while-installing-version-6)) According to the error message, error happens when checking if layout animation is enabled. And suggested [solution](https://stackoverflow.com/a/70337772) is to follow installation instructions or downgrade reanimated as layout animations are introduced in `2.3.0`. I tried downgrading the version, but app still crashes after few reloads. Didn't saw error screen, app just closed on crash. (according to logs, crash looks related to hermes)
Error logs (adb) ``` 09-17 04:36:23.295 19857 19972 F libc : Fatal signal 6 (SIGABRT), code -1 (SI_QUEUE) in tid 19972 (mqt_js), pid 19857 (.ethereum.debug) 09-17 04:36:23.517 20123 20123 F DEBUG : So probably this is not the issue (or only issue). I am not sure if we should even downgrade this library at all. - downgrading will not affect app, as we are not using layouAnimations - but it is not fixing the issue ### Reproduction 1. Make changes in app (7-8 times) without closing it

I tried deleting all commits till my reanimated PR (https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/pull/13470), but crash still happens even before that PR.
not sure, but issue might be related to [reloader](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/blob/develop/src/status_im/reloader.cljs)

@Parveshdhull, I can't say for sure what's the cause, but I did spend many many hours trying to fix this or at least find the root cause of the problem.

In the Android Studio emulator, when I enable the profiler the app **always** crashes when the memory consumption goes above 1GB. I use NixOS and I reproduced this failure on two very different machines, with completely different hardware, but got the exact same behavior. When the app crashes and I inspect status-go logs, it reports an error saying it couldn't allocate memory, but this is so weird, right? I gave the emulator much more than 1GB of memory.

What does help a little bit is configuring the emulator to have less memory available and as little as possible VM heap, just so the Go garbage collector can collect a bit more memory before everything explodes. But it still fails after a handful of refreshes. As you mentioned, it fails even with fast refresh disabled.

I rewrote `status-im.reloader` namespace and even tried disabling the entire reloading logic, in hopes that it was something related to how ShadowCLJS was reloading the app, but it did not make any difference. I tried upgrading Android Studio, but it didn't help either.

One workaround I do that immensely helps is not reloading the app on every save. I changed our shadow-cljs.edn file in a past PR to accept the env var `SHADOW_AUTOBUILD_ENABLED` to be able to disable hot-reload. So what I do is I reload the app manually using the REPL (call `(shadow.cljs.devtools.api/watch-compile-all!)`) only when I want and use the REPL to eval s-exps that I'm changing.

This issue is the most painful problem in my developer workflow...

> (according to logs, crash looks related to hermes)

Yes, looks like Hermes was the issue. After disabling it app is not crashing anymore

>After disabling it app is not crashing anymore

I'm not sure of the implications of disabling Hermes, but it sure fixed the issue in my machine. Thank you for finding a fix.

> Yes, looks like Hermes was the issue. After disabling it app is not crashing anymore

Issue is only with x86 devices. More details in PR [Summary](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/pull/14041)
